website_summaries.verdict: Super cute little sink that gives your kids the chance to play kitchen and doesn't take up too much space.
pros: Kids can fill it and wash their dishes
Comes with plates and silverware to wash
Neutral colors are good for boys or girls
A simple and fun toy for the money
cons: The faucet has to be pumped and does not run off a battery like some other models

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this! He's a little chef, ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this! He's a little chef, already. The sink works as a pump system and it isn't too messy. This was the thing he kept asking for, for Christmas... it wasn't even his biggest gift, his biggest gift was a play house. But he absolutely loves it. It's very good for pretend play and there's room for more than one child to play. It's also good for fine motor skills. I depend on reviews when deciding to purchase a product, a lot of the times reviews will sway me one way or another. With that being said if you found my review to be helpful, please press the helpful button.
customer_reviews.author: Mark and Amanda Harris

customer_reviews.title: Not running water but squirting every time you push on the handle.
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy and somewhat nice i have to admit. I got it for the running water feature but be warned it is pump with one hand to get squirt of water out. Child will not be playing with running water. Child will be either pumpung water to get squirts out or playing with water already in the sink. It is quite a workout to keep it pumping so for the pleasure of your baby be ready to be pumping water for them while they play. My daugheter likes it if i am pumping. That is not why i get toys for her. I want to relax not be with her every minute of the day. Well its just me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very poor design
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cute idea but the pump is SO difficult to push down! It requires a lot of force, much more than my toddler can manage. Which ruins the whole point of independent play. The faucet is also angled too far outward and sprays everywhere. I tried pumping it for several minutes hoping to loosen it up but it didn’t help and honestly, it’s not easy! I was so excited for her to play with this and I’m really disappointed. It cannot be taken apart once assembled so I’m not sure I can return it but I’m going to request it. A big let down!
customer_reviews.author: J. M.

customer_reviews.title: My kids love this. It's big enough that two (smaller) children ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this. It's big enough that two (smaller) children can share space, one on the cooktop and one in the sink. As some other reviewers have mentioned the pump mechanism takes some elbow grease, my 4 year old can do it easily, my 2 year old sometimes needs some help. Really cute overall and great for having a mini play "kitchen" that doesn't take up a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful!!!! My 26 month old son is having the time of his life with it. Easy to assemble, sturdy (my son already stepped into it). Very simple and creative toy. We have not tested the water spout, I prefer dry play for a while. Buy it and have fun!
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Pump for water broke quickly
customer_reviews.text: I was rather excited to get this for my daughters as they always want to help in the kitchen. I attached the pump per the instructions and at first it was working great. They both were enjoying it! In less than hour the pump stopped working. I tried a couple of things to fix it to no avail. The pump itself goes up and down and I can hear parts moving, but the water does not come out of the spout. I genuinely like the Little Tikes brand, but this product fell well short of my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Your kid will need you to pump the water
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize that the sink was not powered by batteries but instead by a pump. The good is that you don't have to buy batteries but the annoying part is that you will get carpel tunnel by needing to pump this for your toddler/preschooler for an hour straight. It's not easy to pump and kind of annoying. I bought this to replace the other brand that has a battery operated sink and broke on us. I think I'll just buy the other one again and keep this one as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Annlee

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: It's unique, and held my grand daughters attention for awhile. It is very hard to push the plunger thing that makes the water come out of the faucet, at least for a 4 year old. The packaging is a little deceiving in my opinion.The water does not spray out as shown, and it only comes out by continually pressing the plunger (which my grand daughter could not do). But it fits in her little play kitchen and she likes it, so it was a good purchase for us.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Keen

customer_reviews.title: great fun for kids!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVES this sink! We're redoing an old entertainment center into a little kitchen for her so this sink will get mounted in there once we're done but for now she's enjoying just playing with it on the floor of our kitchen. Great features, especially the pump for the faucet. She is only 2 and always wants to help with the dishes but is a bit short to stand at our sink so now she stays busy "washing" her stuff while I wash mine! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Little Tikes needs to improve the pump
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great item if it wasn't so hard to use.... ...I am a grown woman and it wasn't easy to pump...for a small child very hard...I gave this to my granddaughter for her 3rd birthday , she couldn't pump the water... It would be great if it was battery operated or a much easy pump...... such a cute toy I would not recommend it for young children
customer_reviews.author: Plum perky

customer_reviews.title: Nice and small play stove / sink
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter loves cooking on her little stove and washing with “pretend water” in her little sink. We do not ever plan to let her know that real water can be used in her “play” sink. The only change I’d make is putting a non-slick surface on the stove burners so that the pots and pans don’t slide off so easily. Stores away easily.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: great but manual pump
customer_reviews.text: Toy feels like it's well made. I wish it was obvious that it was manual and not electronic. Hard for child to pump the water so adult has to do it. if you want the water running you have to constantly pump because you can't charge up the pump. Four stars because it's a well-made product. Electric would have made it a five Star product.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but hard to work
customer_reviews.text: A nice product for apartment living, a play cooking stove and working sink. Gave it a 3 because my 3 (almost 4) year old Grandchild has to stand and use both hands, pushing as hard as she can to get a little water out of the pump faucet. If Little Tikes can work the kinks out of this pump they will have a real winner.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this SO much!!
customer_reviews.text: Literally the best toy ever! We filled the bottom with water and put our toddler in the empty bathtub and he played alone for almost an hour! I highly recommend this toy for anyone who needs a break. Seriously, best purchase of my life. Things to note: * A 19 month old is not strong enough to push the pump once the water is in the basin. The pressure needed is greater than the amount needed prior to filling it up so once it's empty, he/she will push down repeatedly demanding water comes out. Shrieking may happen. * To ensure nothing gross grows in here, be sure to dry thoroughly after every use.
customer_reviews.author: myr

customer_reviews.title: Not what you expect
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this play sink to anyone. First of all the water doesn’t just run you have to continuously manually push on a pump thing for the water to come out which after a couple of pumps your hand starts getting tired so no kiddo will be able to just sit there pushing on it. Then, the stopper doesn’t even click in place, it just sits there so after pumping the water the water doesn’t even stay in the sink it slowly drains which then leads to more pumping to fill back up. My son played with it for like 10-15 minutes and was over it. Waste of money...
customer_reviews.author: ivelise

customer_reviews.title: Compact, works great and all kids love water!
customer_reviews.text: We are fans of all Little Tikes products, but this one is exceptional in both play value and its price point. I have found over the years that the big and bulky kitchen sets that we have owned get little use after time. Why? They don't have any fun features. Every kid loves to play in the water. In the Spring, we all run like crazy buying water tables. I found that this is great indoors during the winter months! Set them up to wash and dry! A creative twist for the older kids would be to have them play restaurant! Comes with a nice selection of dishes/silverware, etc. Sturdy and convenient! Makes a great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Hard to pump
customer_reviews.text: Pump for the faucet is a bit hard for little hands to push so I fill up the sink part with a pitcher and he uses the faucet to "rinse". Overall very happy with it and my 4yr old loves it. And it keeps him out of mine! It's the perfect size, very well made, and definitely great for keeping little kids busy on cold winter days.
customer_reviews.author: EmmaJean

customer_reviews.title: Unusable for target audience
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a great idea for my 2&4 year old kids who love to play in the sink and run the water. BUT! The thing is practically unusable. The pump you push to suck up the water from the reservoir is so hard to push that my kids cannot use it. At least it was cheap, but it's going to end up being donated soon.
customer_reviews.author: WashingtonApple

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: When reading the reviews I thought Ok sounds like fun for the kids. But once i received it and realized you have to pump the pump while playing. Worth to get one with a battery that does the job for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica valdes

customer_reviews.title: Sink is a winner
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves her sink. It is quite messy so if you use indoors put several towels down. My toddler prefers to take the sink top off and just play with the red tub (go figure). Easy to clean and the dishes/pans/utensils that come with it are a bonus. Great to use outside, especially on a hot day. The sink can be easy to turn over for a toddler and older children.
customer_reviews.author: Sky Honey B

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fun toy. My 2 year old son loves playing with it and washing the dishes. He loves to press the pump and have the water spray out. This is easy to clean and very easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Get a sink with an electric motor instead
customer_reviews.text: The pump is manual and too hard to pump for little hands. I got this for my two year old and she only played with it for 15 min. I wish I bought one of those with an electric pump.
customer_reviews.author: IreneR

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact size
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want a big kitchen here, but for when the kids are at my house, they have a few small items like this to make up a "cooking" theme. I do not plan on introducing water, what they don't know makes my life easier. They like the knob and pretending they were cleaning and cooking
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Water play is always a hit.
customer_reviews.text: I took this out in the yard with my one year-old grandson, and he loved it. He quickly caught onto pumping the water through the faucet, a very cute feature. I think if it had been inside, we might have a mess on our hands though! I plan to try that in the future with plenty of towels on the floor for him!
customer_reviews.author: dailychocolate

customer_reviews.title: One of my kids' favorite things to do is play restaurant so I got ...
customer_reviews.text: One of my kids' favorite things to do is play restaurant so I got this to play with at my parents' pool and they love it! The sink is basically a pump so the water drains out of the sink into the basin below and is pumped up through the faucet. My three year old can do it so it isn't difficult. She and my 6 year old boy both like it so it was well worth the $15 we paid for it. A plus for me is that all the accessories fit under the sink/stove so it's just the one piece to store!
customer_reviews.author: Frazier's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Nice but what happened to the price?
customer_reviews.text: I like this thing - bought it because my daughter loves playing with water. Note that the kid has to be at least 2 -2.5 to be able to operate the pump on their own, we had to wait for almost a year before my daughter could use it. Also, what happened to the price??? I bought it last year for $14 dollars, and this year it's over $70???
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Great little sink
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 3 year old grandson for Christmas as he likes to help his parents when they are doing dishes. He is enjoying having his own sink and dishes to wash.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L.

customer_reviews.title: when I gave it to my son he was happy but not much surprised but when he learnt the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very lovely little stove and sink with real water tap, when I gave it to my son he was happy but not much surprised but when he learnt the concept that the water is coming out from the tap, he was very excited and started smiling and immediately washed the little utensils that came with it. It was so much fun watching him play with it but the only complaint about is the hardness to operate the tap to get the water from it. I wish the tap functioning is easy, it could have been a blast.
customer_reviews.author: VSEN

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun, and well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: My grandkids, age 2 and 6 love this! The water squirts out with a good amount of force, and excess drains out to be recycled, so there is not much that end up on the floor. We didn't chose to use it with soap, but if you do, there is a place for the soap, and excess water drains from that as well, but then soapy water would be coming out of faucet. Nice size, and plenty deep.
customer_reviews.author: Katijanae

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this little sink for my sons second birthday because he loves to "Cook". its small enough to keep on the laminate floor of my tiny kitchen and still get around. But big enough for two kiddos to enjoy at once, and ive had children ages 2-7 play with it and have fun. It also comes apart completely for easy cleaning. Only thing i wish I would have paid more attention to was the fact that it is a manual pump sink, not a automatic pump sink.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: The sink is very cute and a good size, however the pump is too hard for ...
customer_reviews.text: The sink is very cute and a good size, however the pump is too hard for my 3 year old to work, he pushes down on it and nothing happens. I have to push on it very hard for any water to come out. For a toy that is aimed at young children I would have expected it to be much easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: So adorable!
customer_reviews.text: So adorable. I have not tested the water mechanism yet but this is just too cute!! Can't wait to see what my 3 year old niece thinks of it. She loves water and she loves to pretend cook so this should be perfect. I will do a follow up review once she plays with it.
customer_reviews.author: M Harley

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old likes to wash her hands over and over again, so I got this for her birthday. Being able to turn the faucet on and leave it on would have been nice, as she's not strong enough to operate the pump with one hand. So be prepared to sit by the sink and pump the water for your kid if they are on the younger side.
customer_reviews.author: Amy F

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter. It great for small spaces. Instead of bu ying a big bulky toy kitchen we bought her this one and she loves it. It’s big enough for her to comfortably play and can be put away anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria I Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Storage is a most
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little sink, perfect if you don’t want a play kitchen at home, you can store the accessories inside for less messes
customer_reviews.author: mommytosma

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best toys we have purchased for our almost 2
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best toys we have purchased for our almost 2.5 year old daughter. She absolutely loves that she can pump the water herself, although it is a little hard for her to push the pump. She is obsessed with water, and loves "cooking" us dinner. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment and waste of $30
customer_reviews.text: The pump is really hard for a 3-yr old girl to push down. This is just not a fun toy, unless I stand and pump the water for her myself the entire time. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jm8675309

customer_reviews.title: Prepare to pump water continuously
customer_reviews.text: You have to pump the water for it to keep coming out. My 2 year old cannot really do it himself. Then, the plug in the sink doesn’t hold it in.
customer_reviews.author: tladouce

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: You have to be physically very strong to push that thing to make the water come out. Without it it's nothing special.
customer_reviews.author: Olena

customer_reviews.title: Overall worth the price
customer_reviews.text: My 1.5 and 3.5 year olds love this toy. My only complaint is getting the water to come out of the faucet is hard for them. Wish it was a bit more kid friendly. It does keep my girls busy for up to an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Good toddler water fun
customer_reviews.text: Super cute! My 2 year old is my really able to push down to make the water come out and hold a cup to fill at the same time--yet. She doesn't love it as much as we thought--yet. She loves playing with the sink faucet water so we thought this would be a good alternative. We'll keep trying to make I more fun for her.
customer_reviews.author: KMorgan

customer_reviews.title: Way Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: When the product initially sold through Target it was $19.99. That seems more reasonable for what you get. It snaps together ok, but isn’t perfect. And my daughter isn’t strong enough to push the pump that pumps the water through the faucet. It’s a decent toy but for the money, I wouldn’t order again and wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sink for boys .....or girls !
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find kitchen stuff for boys (I'm a boy mom) This thing is perfect. It's great for girls too of course, but it's not covered in pink or sparkles. It's well made and works as described. Perfect for 12 months+
customer_reviews.author: Tanna Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: not what we expected
customer_reviews.text: My grandson had a running water sink that lasted over a year he really liked playing with it so we bought this one this time. the water doesn't "run" you have to push handle down and it gives one spray of water wished i got the spark one he liked it a lot better
customer_reviews.author: Tracie Woodburn

customer_reviews.title: We have gotten a lot of enjoyment out of this with our 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: We have gotten a lot of enjoyment out of this with our 3 year old, who sits on a beach towel on the kitchen floor playing in her sink. You can't actually use bubbles, and it's a bit hard to get the pump working (it falls apart when you take out the top from the bottom) but when it's put together properly it works really well! I like that you can separate the two pieces- sometimes we only use the red part. :)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Messenger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift!
customer_reviews.text: My three year old son loves this! So glad I went with a hand pump one over a battery operated one. Works so well and my son loves having to pump the water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little sink
customer_reviews.text: This little sink is a fun toy for 2 year old son. He likes to pretend that he is washing the dishes and cooking for for me. He is able to pump the sink to make the water come out but it does require some effort. My only complaint is when trying to separate the top from the bottom to add water, it can be difficult. Otherwise we love it.
customer_reviews.author: coopertipsy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy idea
customer_reviews.text: When I saw this nifty lil toy sink I had to get it for my son cuz he was all bout copying everything mommy did & for his young age he loved to clean... So I made it work & when he grew out of it I have my granddaughter to pass it down too which she loves it too!!!!
customer_reviews.author: selina

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought it was
customer_reviews.text: Water does not run on its own you have to pump it and it's hard to pump. My kids lost interest really quick
customer_reviews.author: timford88

customer_reviews.title: No continuous flow of water
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 's 2 year old birthday but he can't really work the pump. Seem you have to use the pump to get any water out of the faucet. There is no continuous stream of water. My 5 year old enjoyed playing with it for a little while.
customer_reviews.author: YR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. My 2 1/2 year old Grand-daughter LOVES doing her dishes while MaMa does the real dishes in the real sink! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Peg

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy but tricky for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but needs a little upgrading. The pump is really tricky for little ones to push down on their own and the water squirts out much more fiercely than I expected so it splashes a lot (which is to be expected with a toy sink I suppose). My three year old does enjoy playing with it but I just wish the faucet feature was a little more kid Friendly.
customer_reviews.author: cjules182

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to press the pump "faucet" to expel water
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves playing with this toy. It is very easy to press the pump "faucet" to expel water. It comes a pan, cups, plates and utensils which is perfect for making mud pies. There is a drain at the bottom of the sink which drains into the inside and the pump uses that water. So the water is reused which is great since you don't have to keep refilling it.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany T Roy

customer_reviews.title: Wow, this was an amazing idea. My 2 yr old love this toy sink
customer_reviews.text: OMG, this is absolutely brilliant. I use to have to sit at the sink with my 2 year old grandson while he washed my dishes and wanted to continuously run the water and he use to have a fit when it was time to get down. Wow, to make this sink actually be able to dispense water was absolutely brilliant it is his favorite thing to do with this sink, thank goodness I no longer have to feel guilty with him running my sink water. It even comes with dishes. Awesome guys!
customer_reviews.author: loly delacruz31

customer_reviews.title: Great little playset
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this play set for my daughter and my niece, I originally looked at full size sets but I thought this would be great because it would not take as much space and it is portable. It was a hit right away, the two of them are really into pretend play and can play with this for hours. Assembly was a breeze, minutes after opening it and putting it together they were able to play with it. Even without water in the sink they have just as much fun playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Chester

customer_reviews.title: Cooler than expected. This toy sink has a real ...
customer_reviews.text: Cooler than expected. This toy sink has a real drain with a stopper and a hollow area underneath. We put water in it and the sprayer works as a pump that sprays the water from the faucet. My 4 year old has been playing with it and nothing else (his toy foods and dishes with shopping cart) since he got it 3 days ago. He wanted to sleep with it!lol
customer_reviews.author: IamS

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my two year old! She loves it so much and could play with it for hours. It took her a day or two to learn how to press down on the button. But now she’s gotten the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe A

customer_reviews.title: Good full kitchen alternative
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to splurge and get a full kitchen, but did want my son to engage in imaginary play. My son is 19 months and actually most enjoys sitting in the sink. For the price, it's fine - I think mine has an issue with the pump, but I'm okay with that because I am not interested in the water aspect as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: knia

customer_reviews.title: Missing screws!
customer_reviews.text: This was great if it had complete parts. Ours didn’t have the screws included. Flipped the whole box but nothing. :(
customer_reviews.author: Maizie G

customer_reviews.title: Super cute
customer_reviews.text: Got this since for my Niece and nephew! They love it! Fill the red base with water and the faucet squirts!
customer_reviews.author: Luann

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 year old niece who loves to play in the sink. This is an excellent alternative and much safer. This little sink is great and comes with a good amount of accessories. It takes some force to push the button to make the faucet work. It would be nice if that were a little easier, but all in all, it's a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Not our favorite
customer_reviews.text: We had the battery operated sink where the water flows continuously when it is on. This sink you have to pump the water out manually and it's kind of hard for little hands and not as much fun.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Raybs

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love it and kids love it too. It's big enough for everyone to enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Bamby

customer_reviews.title: It’s a very nice little sink easy to use granddaughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very nice little sink easy to use granddaughter loves it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: LOVED IT!! My grandaughter (3) plays with it all the time! She's had it 3months now and it is holding up beautifully! Great purchase! Thank you ♡
customer_reviews.author: Tami Darby

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product! Very durable..will probably last forever :) And the kids LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my niece for Christmas and she absolutely LOVES it!!! I know this summer she will play with it all the time in the yard! I think I paid $12 for it- what an awesome deal :) The kids have a blast with it. Just keep in mind that you should put a towel under neath, if the kids are going to play with it inside the house to try to prevent to much of a water mess! Great product and very durable- will probably last forever!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Great product and perfect for a busy child.
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old LOVES this, the first day we got it he was busy playing for 3 hours. Yup, 3 hours he was "washing" dishes and cooking. I keep it inside on the dining table and dump the water each night. We have played with it outside but the dirt seems to scrape up the plastic and junk up in the tubes for the water. Indoor is best for us.
customer_reviews.author: VRae

customer_reviews.title: Ask and you shall receive
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my friends 3yo (per her request). I received many photos of the kids playing with it. I assume it is enjoyed by kids.
customer_reviews.author: Damon L. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: I love the idea of this
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this. I bought it for my 2 year old on her birthday, it is a little tough to push the button by herself, but now about 4 months later, she totally gets it. She loves to splash in it and wash dishes. It's small, table top type thing, which is great for a table outside or in the bathtub. I would recommend for children over 2.5 year old.
customer_reviews.author: jro

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Toy Amazing Price $13
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this! I had waited for a long time for this because I saw it in store on clearance and then couldn't find it ever since. Once I did find it online it was too expensive. The price varies on amazon and I finally saw it at $13 so I bought it. What a great toy and a great price!!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony and Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Loved this toy, great value for $. Water can be a little hard to pump for kiddos...easy cleanup & hours of fun
customer_reviews.author: Heathyr P

customer_reviews.title: The grandkids love it!
customer_reviews.text: My grandkids love this little sink! We use it a lot during the hot Texas summers. Something fun to do under the covered patio! I’ve had mine a couple of years and am going to order an extra one to cut down on the arguing because once one kid wants to play with it they all do! The only negative is the pump is hard for the younger ones but that’s it. Have fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun things you can do with this!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun toy for outside or inside. Outside we like to fill it with water & dish soap for bubbly fun. And inside we just use the kitchen utensils & such it came with. It's really fun to cook & make noise with. My 2 year old daughter really enjoys it no matter what. We've also put dry rice or Beans in it too for a sensory activity.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Penny

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: Super cute. Bought for my daughters 4th birthday and she loves it. Great purchase if you don’t want the huge kitchen, and works great outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Kim B.

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. No batteries. Just imagine play for my grandson who loves water. Put down towel and set on floor. Not enough water to make a huge mess but enough for hrs of fun
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Hamill

customer_reviews.title: Huge hit with niece, good value for price
customer_reviews.text: Huge hit with the niece. Actually "dispenses" water from the faucet. Kids love to play with water and do "imaginative" play. Fairly large item. Seems sturdy and comes with nice accessory pack that is worth at least $7 if purchased separately. Good value for price
customer_reviews.author: nekko925

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful toy kitchen/ sink
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful toy kitchen/ sink. My daughter loves playing with it for hours. Everything about it is perfect except that it splashes a little and the pump is very hard to press. Very simple to set up and it comes apart to dry. Best part is it comes with 10 accessories and of excellent quality. We surely are thrilled with this kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Su Kay

customer_reviews.title: It's a great concept! Was a little disappointed that it can't ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a great concept! Was a little disappointed that it can't actually be used with soap (bubbles), but it doesn't seem to bother the kids. It's a little tough for my toddler to pump the water through, but, with a little help, it makes a fun outdoor summer toy!
customer_reviews.author: emkMadison

customer_reviews.title: All her little friends like to play with it too
customer_reviews.text: We keep this in the kitchen. When I do the dishes, my daughter does her dishes. She loves that water comes out! All her little friends like to play with it too.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: bought this on a whim - good choice
customer_reviews.text: On the surface this looks like something for a baby - but it is appropriate for 5 and up. Nothing gives my daughter more pride than rinsing off her plates, cups and utensils. It does not splash too much if you keep under a gallon or 2 in the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy!
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this weve had it a few months now and the pump has broken but he still loves to play with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Paffhouse

customer_reviews.title: Huge hit. 3 yr old loves it
customer_reviews.text: It was a huge hit with my 3yr old. Has played with it everyday since Christmas
customer_reviews.author: Marks

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: My 3 y.o loves this and plays with it for hours! It is literally the only tou he will play with for more than a minute or two.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves her sink. She can help mommy wash dishes now!
customer_reviews.author: Connie Strong

customer_reviews.title: 3 & 6 year old happy to do dishes
customer_reviews.text: Cute toy. It does take a little effort to spray the water out, but it even keeps my 3 and 6 year old busy. I think anyone under 3 might need help with the sprayer. It is still fun even without the water coming out. My kids like to bring this in the tub (warning:it takes up a lot of space in there!)
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Okay, waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that my 2 years old couldn't pump the sink... It was super hard and don't know when shell get that kind of strength needed
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and cant beat the price
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it and she likes doing dishes with us
customer_reviews.author: James p.

customer_reviews.title: Bought for DIY kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I'm making a diy play kitchen and searched far & wide for the perfect sink before buying this. My kids (1 & 3) played with this for 2 hours as soon as I opened the box & then brought it in the tub for another hour. DO NOT put it anywhere youre not ok with getting soaked. It fell over in the kitchen & separeted & all the water went everywhere. It was a wonderful find for the play kitchen since it has burners, knobs, a faucet & accessories. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Torri T.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: My 3yr old loves this we play with it daily. She thinks she's cooking and cleaning like mommy
customer_reviews.author: Lala

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love it. They always want to wash dishes at home.
customer_reviews.author: Yesi

customer_reviews.title: A good investment...
customer_reviews.text: Very entertaining toy! Just wish it had a mode that kept the water squirting from the faucet so the child can play with the water as it's going into the sink. It seems to be easier to push down the pump from the back/side, which makes it challenging to play in the sink simultaneously.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Splish splash fun!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8 month hold and 3 year old for backyard and camping. It packs small for travel . the dials makes noise. The faucet really works. There is a small push pump to make faucet work. Great outdoor fun!
customer_reviews.author: ducky

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: my daughter just love love lovvvve this.....she's 4 and just got this today. ...i love how she has her independent to wash her own dishes and can do ir at her pace. she have cooking utensils and food that she can play with til her other stuff comes in the mail.....im very happy
customer_reviews.author: jenni

customer_reviews.title: this sink is pretty fun my grandson uses in the tub it really ...
customer_reviews.text: this sink is pretty fun my grandson uses in the tub it really has water come out the spout when you pump, the pump is a little hard I have to pump
customer_reviews.author: minor

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Best $10.99 ever spent. My two year old loves this and plays with multiple hours a day with it. The pump for the water is his favorite part, we haven't tried it with water yet. The dishes and silverware are actually better quality than I expected. I expect this to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lansing

customer_reviews.title: Very fun for little ones!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter enjoyed this little sink very much. We could use it inside and outside.
customer_reviews.author: brysgirl13

customer_reviews.title: The pump for water is tough for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I don’t know where to put the sink, and the pump is too difficult for my almost 3 year old to pump for water.
customer_reviews.author: Trent S Miller

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves doing the dishes and loves playing with ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves doing the dishes and loves playing with this set! The faucet pump can be challenging for little hands.
customer_reviews.author: CO Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. Little hard for toddler to push handle for water but he loves it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clean it up!
customer_reviews.text: I think it is neat and it gives my four year old son a little bit of a work out. The water, so long as the kid isn't strong enough to move the sink, will stay inside the sink. It is a cute little toy equipped with all the little things kids who want to wash the dishes would want-dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Symantha

product_meta.title: Little Tikes Splish Splash Sink & Stove
product_meta.description:
Playing in the sink has never been more fun! The Splish Splash Sink & Stove™ is an affordable, portable and easy to clean product that will spark your little one’s imagination to play in the kitchen just like mom and dad. Kids will love the real working faucet that really pumps water! With 13 accessories, kids will have fun learning the basic functions of a kitchen. The possibilities are endless with the Splish Splash Sink & Stove™.

Features:

•Easy to assemble

•Real working faucet

•Clicking knobs

•Easy to clean

•Working drain

•Portable and easy to take on the go

•All accessories store in the base for easy cleanup
feature_bullets: Portable toy sink and stove with real working faucet and drain
Large sink area for water play and kitchen role-play
Storage in base for all accessories

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars772 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
